children.text: Content Standard 1: Students shall listen to, analyze, describe, and evaluate a variety of music.
Describe musical instruments by sight and sound
Describe vocal classifications
Analyze aurally various musical forms and styles

Demonstrate an understanding of the language of music
  • elements
  • symbols
Develop criteria for evaluating musical performances (e.g., live, recorded)
Evaluate musical performances orally and in written format (e.g., journal, blog, graphic organizer, multimedia)

Describe the characteristics of a varied repertoire of music after listening
  • program music (e.g., Peter and the Wolf, Sorcerers Apprentice)
  • American music (e.g., "Yankee Doodle," "Rhapsody in Blue," hollers)
  • music by Arkansas composers (e.g., William Grant Still, Scott Joplin, Johnny Cash, Glen Campbell)
  • music from various historical periods
  • world music
Content Standard 2: Students shall demonstrate and apply knowledge of connections between music and other disciplines.
Differentiate the functions and roles of music and musicians in various cultures and disciplines throughout history
Research diverse vocations and avocations in the music field
Describe appropriate audience etiquette (e.g., theatrical production, art museum, concert, dance recital, ballet)
Content Standard 3: Students shall explore and demonstrate an understanding of the concepts, practices, and historical foundations of the visual arts.
Discuss the elements of art and principles of design as tools that provide a universal language for the arts
Use a variety of historical references to produce art (e.g., architecture, jewelry, mosaics)
Research the importance of the arts in history, heritage, and local cultures (e.g., masks, visual culture)
Explore the arts using common themes across different time periods
Content Standard 4: Students shall reflect and respond in a variety of ways to the visual arts of self and the global community.
Produce a visual artwork that is inspired by and/or is connected to the other performing arts (e.g., costumes, backdrops, stage sets, murals, programs for productions)
Critique works of art
Discuss various purposes for creating art (e.g., aesthetic, functional, historical, cultural, therapeutic, social enjoyment, careers, environmental)
Recognize the arts as creative expression that transcends direct verbal communication in different cultures
Discuss ways the arts are used in contemporary media
